English: Everon hills
One month later, Everon
Everon... Malden... Kolguyev...
Everon... Kolguyev... Everon... Malden...
What are we even fighting for? What is the desired result? How does Volkov get there?
The second uprising... The absolute failure of the first invasion... The clsoe victory on Kolguyev...
The 3rd Army under Zubarev... The 10th army as reinforcements, now under Zubarev...\nThe 6th Marine regiment, transferred as reinforcements under Zubarev.

Volkov as the supreme commander of our forces... We have enough strength to go on the offensive.,",lemontov
STRM_32v07,From Stas's report
Czech: Kremlin gave in reluctantly. The general secretary does not trust Volkov. But losing Soviet soil on Kolguyev is out of the question."

English: Hm... Volkov, Zubarev, Burtsov, Moltov, Limyen, Garodsky, Yenotov, Dyrbov, Aspidov and Shvernik... Suspected or confirmed supporters of Volkov.\nSome of the names I recognize from Livanoch. Is Volkov the continuation? Of what though?
Most are officers in the army, but also politicans and oligarchs. Quite a group. Volkov has connections.
What is the endgame? Why this archipelago again? Livanoch had to take Malden to get in range to fire his missiles.\nThat cannot be Volkov's plan, he might as well just use a nuclear submarine.
Everon... Although an epicentre for both wars, it is not the price. The island is between Malden and Kolguyev.\nWhoever controls it can launch attacks against the other.
Everon is only a stepping stone. A launching pad for the true invasion - of Malden.
Whatever Volkov desires is on Malden. But what is it?
Comrade major, enjoying the night's breeze?
Too cold for that, Kaplinsky. What's the situation?
We unloaded the latest shipment of weapons from Kolguyev. We also secured the hills, there is no enemy patrol this side of the mountains.
Good work.
You can always count on us, comrade major.
Then let's go. We have to strike before dusk.
Good luck, Russian.
Something's off...
